content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is a quartic polynomial of the form <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals a open parentheses x minus r subscript 1 close parentheses open parentheses x minus r subscript 2 close parentheses open parentheses x minus r subscript 3 close parentheses open parentheses x minus r subscript 4 close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>4</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> is a real number and the values of <math alttext="r subscript i"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> are integers. It is known that the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> are <math alttext="open parentheses negative 1 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open parentheses 2 comma 0 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is <math alttext="open parentheses 0 comma 24 close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>24</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has two real zeros each with multiplicity <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: ​There is sufficient information to define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts and the multiplicity of zeros can be used to determine the <math alttext="r subscript i"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> values, and the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept can be used to find <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>.

​There is sufficient information to define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> because the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept value <math alttext="24"><mn>24</mn></math> can be factored into the product of at least <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> integers involving the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts, and the multiplicity of zeros is known.

​There is insufficient information to define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> because although the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts and the multiplicity of zeros can be used to determine the <math alttext="r subscript i"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> values, the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept can only be used to find <math alttext="open vertical bar a close vertical bar"><mfenced close="|" open="|"><mi>a</mi></mfenced></math> but not the sign of <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>.

​There is insufficient information to define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> because only two of the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts are known, and the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept and multiplicity of zeros do not provide enough information to determine the other two values of  <math alttext="r subscript i"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> or the value of <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>.

content.answer: ​There is sufficient information to define <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-intercepts and the multiplicity of zeros can be used to determine the <math alttext="r subscript i"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> values, and the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-intercept can be used to find <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math>.
